publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5791 Ms Maureen Watt: Scottish Gas Card Replacement Charge—That the Parliament notes with concern the Scottish Gas policy of charging £8 for replacement gas prepayment cards; further notes that prepayment is a payment method most commonly used by people on low incomes for whom £8 might cover the cost of household gas for a week; further deems this to be an unreasonable and unfair charge by Scottish Gas on vulnerable people for a basic necessity, and urges the company to reconsider this policy. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*, Brian Adam*, Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rosie Kane*, Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*, Eleanor Scott*, John Swinburne*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Shiona Baird*, Rob Gibson*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5791 Scottish Gas Card Replacement Charge (lodged on 27 March 2007) Fergus Ewing*, Chris Ballance*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Richard Lochhead*, Ms Sandra White*
